parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains "CMF11240002" at the end. This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for tracking and reporting campaign finance.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions "Ilie Bolojan" and promotes the PNL (National Liberal Party) list for the parliamentary elections in Bucharest.  This directly refers to a candidate and a party participating in the elections, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, targeting a wide audience in Bucharest, exceeding the limits of personal communication.  The reach estimate is ">1M", confirming its broad reach. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The explicit call to "Votează lista PNL București pentru alegerile #Parlamentare!" clearly demonstrates an electoral objective: to influence voters to support the PNL list. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The content is not journalistic in nature. While it presents a concise statement about Ilie Bolojan's project, it lacks the objectivity and depth of journalistic reporting.  The primary purpose is clearly promotional, not informative.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post does not express a personal opinion; it's a direct appeal for votes, promoting a specific candidate and party.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>585218097425254</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific candidate (Ilie Bolojan), is used during the electoral campaign (although the end date is given as 1732953600, which needs to be checked against the actual end date of the campaign), has a clear electoral objective (to increase votes for PNL), and targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement. The presence of the CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The argument against it being propaganda is weak; it's a clear and direct advertisement for a political party and candidate.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Ilie Bolojan</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNL</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Partidul Național Liberal, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 585218097425254) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează direct candidatul Ilie Bolojan și lista PNL București pentru alegerile parlamentare, cu un buget de 1.500-2.000 RON, atingând peste 1 milion de oameni.  Postarea conține un apel explicit la vot ("Votează lista PNL București pentru alegerile #Parlamentare!") și numărul CMF11240002, indicând clar natura sa de propagandă electorală.  Această acțiune, având ca efect electoral creșterea numărului de voturi pentru PNL, constituie o încălcare clară a legii, deoarece continuă propaganda electorală după încheierea perioadei legale.  Informațiile de contact ale Partidului Național Liberal sunt disponibile la comunicare@pnl.ro și +40743831906.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
